events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection, requiring immediate assistance.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial accident report and customer’s description.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to handle all communications and coordinate further investigation steps.
The insurance company has officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the process will proceed promptly.
Customer was requested to submit the police accident report, photos of the vehicle damage, and contact details of witnesses.
The customer submitted all requested documentation including the accident report and detailed photos showing the extent of the collision damage.
The insurance company commenced a thorough investigation of the auto accident claim by reviewing submitted evidence and contacting involved parties.
Investigation concluded with favorable findings supporting the liability of the other party in the car collision incident.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the estimated repair costs and any related expenses due to the auto accident.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the compensation amount and overall service.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer.
The insurance payment was issued promptly to the customer’s bank account to cover the auto repair expenses as per the approved claim.
The insurance claim was officially closed after confirming the customer’s acknowledgment of full settlement and completion of repairs.
